word.entryDescription: your female parent
word.entryExample: My mother always helps me with my homework.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a vehicle with two wheels and an engine, that you sit on and ride
word.entryExample: My brother rides a big motorbike.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a natural place like a very big hill that is much higher than all the land around it
word.entryExample: There's snow on the mountains.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small animal with a long tail that often lives in buildings
word.entryExample: Our cat is looking for a mouse.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an area of hair which a man may grow just below his nose
word.entryExample: Shall I put a big, brown moustache on Tom?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of the body that you use for talking and eating
word.entryExample: Your mouth is under your nose.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to change position
word.entryExample: If you can't see, move closer to the board.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place where people go to look at old or unusual things
word.entryExample: I visited lots of museums when i was in New York.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small soft grey vegetable with a round top used in cooking
word.entryExample: Mushrooms grow in our garden,
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a pattern of sounds that you make with an instrument that is pleasant to listen to
word.entryExample: I love this music. What's the name of this band?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: obligation; used to show that something is necessary or very important, or that it is a rule
word.entryExample: I must help my brother with his homework.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: (opposite of 'must') obligation; used to show that something is necessary or very important, or that it is a rule
word.entryExample: You mustn't play computer games in the evening.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: your name is what people call you
word.entryExample: My name is Sam.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: behaving badly
word.entryExample: The puppies are very naughty.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not far away in distance
word.entryExample: My house is near the river.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of the body between your chest and your head
word.entryExample: A giraffe has a very long neck.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to have to have or do something, or to want something very much
word.entryExample: I need to buy some flour to make a cake.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place that is built or chosen by animals, particularly birds, in which to lay their eggs, raise their young, live or sleep
word.entryExample: There are three small birds in the this nest.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: at no time
word.entryExample: I never play football.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is new has not been used before
word.entryExample: Is this your new bike?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large city in the United States of America
word.entryExample: Anna lives in New York.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: being the first one after the present one or the one just mentioned
word.entryExample: What's the next question to our new student?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: on one side of a person or thing
word.entryExample: This chair next to me is free - you can sit down.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: kind or pleasant
word.entryExample: Jill is a very nice girl.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of the 24-hour day when it is dark
word.entryExample: I don't like travelling at night.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 9
word.entryExample: We have nine guests for dinner tonight.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 19
word.entryExample: There are nineteen students in the class.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in the position of number nine when we count
word.entryExample: Alex got a bike for his ninth birthday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: no longer, not any more
word.entryExample: The cat was hungry because there was no more food in the kitchen.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: making a lot of unwelcome sound
word.entryExample: My class is very noisy.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the direction that is normally at the top of a map; opposite south
word.entryExample: It's cold in the north of the country.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the northern end of the earth's axis of rotation,
word.entryExample: It's cold and snowy at the North Pole.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of the face between your mouth and your eyes
word.entryExample: The ball hit my friend on the nose.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: at the present time
word.entryExample: I'm not hungry now.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: somebody who looks after sick or injured people, or an assistant to a doctor
word.entryExample: Is your mum a nurse here?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a dry fruit inside a hard shell which grows on a tree
word.entryExample: I like chocolate with nuts in it.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: used with the numbers 1 to 12 to show that the time is exactly on the hour
word.entryExample: I go to bed at 9 o'clock in the evening.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: used to emphasise that you are saying 'yes' when giving permission
word.entryExample: Can you help me with the fire? Of course, Jack.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place where people work, usually at desks
word.entryExample: Is your office near here?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is old has lived or existed for a long time
word.entryExample: How old is this cat?
word.label: ydp

word.entryExample: Let's go on foot. It's quicker.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 10
word.entryExample: I'm in class one.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a round vegetable with many ayers which has a strong smell and taste
word.entryExample: Onions sometimes make you cry.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: when you open something, it is no longer closed and you can move through it, or see inside it
word.entryExample: Can you open the door?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: on the other side of; facing
word.entryExample: There's a shop opposite this hotel.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: somebody who checks people's eyes and sells glasses
word.entryExample: I'm going to an optician to get some new glasses.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a round fruit with a thick orange skin and juicy orange flesh
word.entryExample: Oranges grow on trees in hot countries.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not inside
word.entryExample: The children are playing outside in the garden.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of equipment or part of a cooker; it is like a box with door which you cook food in
word.entryExample: Put the cake in the oven for 30 minutes.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: above or covering something
word.entryExample: Look! The cat is jumping over the table.
word.label: ydp
